thread.title: Intense lobbying characterises PM election for Dormaa Central
thread.title_full: Intense lobbying characterises PM election for Dormaa Central

title: Intense lobbying characterises PM election for Dormaa Central
text:
Politics | 15 October 2015 17:00 CET Intense lobbying characterises PM election for Dormaa Central By GNA 
Dormaa - Ahenkro (B/A), Oct. 15, GNA - Intense lobbying has characterised the election of a Presiding Member (PM) for the Dormaa Central Municipal Assembly as the four nominees vying for the position enter into a third round of voting on Friday, October 16. 
None of them has indicated his intention to withdraw from the contest, which is expected to produce another nerve wracking moments at the Assembly's Conference Hall. 
All of them are extremely optimistic about the chance of winning. 
Two rounds of voting could not produce a winner last Tuesday after the inauguration and swearing in of the newly constituted 40-member Assembly, comprising 30 elected and 10 government appointees, because none of them could secure the required two/thirds majority to emerge a winner. 
They are Barimah Yeboah Kordie, the Aduanahene of Dormaa Traditional Area, Mr. Kofi Beneabesi, the immediate past PM, Mr. Kwadwo Opuni Frimpong, a teacher, and Mr Edwin Akrasi Tannor, a business Consultant. 
Mr. Christian Boafo Offeh, the Dormaa Municipal Electoral Officer, said after the two unsuccessful attempts to elect the PM that 'the candidates might have to do hard lobbying to avoid stalemate, else the exercise would continue unending.' 
GNA
